info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:52PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Washington and southwestern Iron Counties through 330 PM MDT... At 252 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles northwest of New Harmony, or 24 miles east of Beaver Dam, moving west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Enterprise and Newcastle. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 18 between mile markers 36 and 51. Utah Route 56 between mile markers 18 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
